ComicInfo.Title: The English Titles Don't Quite Match The Action In Foreign Movies; Future TV Ad; Kovacs' Strangely Believe It!; Why I Left The Army And Became A Civilian; The Unfortunate Part of Feeding Pigeons Homemade Popcorn; Vending Machines of The Future; Hollywood Is Ruining Marlin Brando; Kovacs' Strangely Believe It!; High-School Dance; Scenes We'd Like To See: The Overhanging Bough; The Russian Titles Don't Quite Match The Action In American Movies
ComicInfo.Summary:
The English Titles Don't Quite Match The Action In Foreign Movies: Typical scenes from foreign movies with subtitles that don't describe what's going on.
Future TV Ad: Phony ad storyboard for Perfecut Knives from Elkon.
Kovacs' Strangely Believe It!: Strange things around the world.
Why I Left The Army And Became A Civilian: Story of the ways civilian life is much better than Army life.
The Unfortunate Part of Feeding Pigeons Homemade Popcorn: Man feed pigeons homemade popcorn and the birds, nearby pets, and all the bystanders in the park go nuts for it.
Vending Machines of The Future: Shows various future vending machines such as for livestock, autos, and more vending machines.
Hollywood Is Ruining Marlin Brando: Examples of changes in Brando's life and attitude, with advice for changing back.
Kovacs' Strangely Believe It!: Strange things around the world.
High-School Dance: Story of planning and evening's events at a typical high school dance.
Scenes We'd Like To See: The Overhanging Bough: A Marshall tries to hide from some outlaws by climbing onto a tree branch, but his horse betrays him.
The Russian Titles Don't Quite Match The Action In American Movies: Scenes from the movie "Marty" as "Martski", with subtitles in Russian that don't describe what's going on.
ComicInfo.Penciller: Wally Wood,Don Martin,Wallace Wood,George Woodbridge,Bob Clarke,Joe Orlando
ComicInfo.Inker: Wally Wood,Don Martin,Wallace Wood,George Woodbridge,Bob Clarke,Joe Orlando
